app.title: Cachy
app.backupButtonTitle: Create a backup of all settings and data
app.restoreButtonTitle: Restore data from a backup file
app.restoreConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to restore this backup? All current settings, presets, and journal entries will be irreversibly overwritten. This action cannot be undone.
app.backupEncryptQuestion: Do you want to encrypt this backup with a password?
app.backupPasswordRequired: A password is required for encryption.
app.backupPasswordEntryPrompt: This backup is encrypted. Please enter the password:
app.enterBackupPassword: Please enter the password for this backup:
app.offlineMessage: Connection Lost - Trading functionality may be limited.

legal.disclaimerBody:
No Financial Advice: This application ('Cachy') is a software tool provided for educational, informational, and simulation purposes only. The calculations, results, and signals generated by this application are hypothetical and do not constitute financial, investment, legal, or tax advice.

Use at Own Risk: Trading cryptocurrencies and derivatives involves a high degree of risk and can result in the loss of your entire capital. You are solely responsible for your trading decisions and the configuration of this tool. The developers of Cachy assume no liability for any financial losses or damages resulting from the use of this application, including but not limited to software errors, data inaccuracies, or connectivity issues.

By clicking 'I understand and accept', you acknowledge that you have read this disclaimer and agree to use this application at your own risk.

dashboard.configureApiKeys: Please configure API keys in settings.
dashboard.totalTradeMetricsTooltip: Overview of key metrics for the entire trade.
dashboard.riskPerTradeCurrencyTooltip: The absolute monetary amount you risk max.
dashboard.totalFeesTooltip: Estimated total costs for this trade.
dashboard.maxPotentialProfitTooltip: Maximum net profit if the entire position is closed at the best TP.
dashboard.weightedRRTooltip: Average risk/reward ratio of all partial sales.
dashboard.totalNetProfitTooltip: Cumulative net profit from all partial sales.
dashboard.netProfitTooltip: Estimated profit for this partial sale.
dashboard.partialVolumeTooltip: Amount of units for this partial sale.
dashboard.connectNews: Connect your news APIs to view sentiment analysis.

alerts.loadedIntoInputs: Loaded {symbol} into trade inputs. Configure TP/SL there and submit.

tradeSetupInputs.priceDeviationWarning: Warning: Entry price deviates by {percent}% from market. Check input.

takeProfitTargets.tooltip: Here you see calculated metrics for each partial take-profit target.
takeProfitTargets.emptyState: No targets defined. Add a target above.

summaryResults.maxNetLossTooltip: Maximum amount you can lose on this trade, including fees.
summaryResults.requiredMarginTooltip: Capital blocked from your account for this trade.
summaryResults.estimatedLiquidationPriceTooltip: Estimated price where your position will be liquidated.
summaryResults.breakEvenPriceTooltip: Price where your trade breaks even considering fees.

dashboard.promptForData: Please enter required trade data to start calculation.

journal.title: Trade Journal
journal.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this trade?
journal.confirmRecalculateAtr: Do you want to recalculate all ATR values in the journal? This may take a moment if you have many trades.
journal.csvTooManyLines: Too many lines ({count} trades). Maximum: {max} trades per import. Please split the CSV file.
journal.csvEmpty: CSV is empty or has only a header.
journal.csvMissingColumns: CSV file missing required columns (or unknown language): {columns}

descriptions.leakageWaterfall: PnL Waterfall: Analysis of gross result minus fees and slippage.
descriptions.leakageTags: Strategies or tags causing the biggest losses.
descriptions.leakageTiming: Times when the biggest losses occur.
descriptions.equityCurve: Total capital progression based on all closed trades.
descriptions.drawdown: Shows the decline from the last equity high.
descriptions.confluenceMatrix: Correlation matrix of day of the week and time of day. Identifies your 'Golden Hours' and loss phases.
descriptions.cumulativeR: Sum of all R-Multiples over time. Shows performance adjusted for position size.
descriptions.longVsShort: Comparison of net profits between Long and Short positions.
descriptions.bottomSymbols: The 5 trading pairs with the largest losses.
descriptions.riskConsistency: Shows how consistent your risk per trade (in % of account) is.
descriptions.grossVsNet: Comparison of profit before (Gross) and after (Net) fees.
descriptions.cumulativeFees: The sum of all fees paid over time.
descriptions.feeBreakdown: Breakdown of costs into Trading Fees and Funding Fees.
descriptions.durationPnl: PnL and Win Rate grouped by trade duration buckets.
descriptions.heatmap: Calendar view of daily PnL performance.
descriptions.forecast: Simulates 100 possible futures based on your historical trades. The cone shows the range between Worst-Case (10th percentile) and Best-Case (90th percentile).
descriptions.rollingWinRate: Your win rate over the last 20 trades. Shows if you are running 'hot' or 'cold'.
descriptions.rollingPF: Your Profit Factor over the last 20 trades. Values above 1.0 are profitable.
descriptions.rollingSQN: System Quality Number (SQN) over 20 trades. > 2.0 is good, > 5.0 is excellent.
descriptions.directionEvolution: Cumulative Profit separated by Long and Short.
descriptions.mfeVsMae: Visualizes exit timing. X-Axis: MAE (Max Pain), Y-Axis: MFE (Max Gain). Top-Left is ideal (Sniper Entry).
descriptions.sixSegment: Detailed breakdown of wins/losses/breakevens separated by Long and Short.
descriptions.riskRadar: Holistic view of your risk profile across 5 dimensions.
descriptions.rMultipleDist: Distribution of trade results in multiples of risk (R).
descriptions.riskRewardScatter: Relationship between risked amount and realized PnL.
descriptions.assetBubble: Bubble size = Trade count. Top right = High Winrate & Profit.
descriptions.dayOfWeekPnl: Gross profits and losses per day of the week.
descriptions.durationVsPnl: Relationship between hold time and profit/loss. Do you recognize patterns in short vs. long trades?
descriptions.hourlyPnl: Gross profits (green) and gross losses (red) per time of day. Helps identify when you are profitable and when you lose money.
descriptions.longShortWinRate: Comparison of win rates between Long and Short trades.
descriptions.recovery: Progression of your drawdowns. Shows how quickly you recover from losses.

seo.title: Cachy - Position Size & Risk Calculator
seo.description: Cachy is a comprehensive trading calculator for position sizing, risk management, and take-profit targets. Optimize your trades with real-time calculations and visual analysis.
seo.keywords: Trading Calculator, Position Sizing, Risk Management, Take Profit, Crypto Trading, Forex Trading, Stock Trading, Trading Tools, Financial Calculator, Trade Optimizer

calculation.recommendation: Recommendation: Select 2-3 timeframes that match your trading style.
calculation.profilesDesc: Choose a preset matching your trading style.
calculation.intervalHelp: How often technical indicators are recalculated.
calculation.favoritesHelp: When disabled, only your top 4 favorite symbols are analyzed.
calculation.pauseHelp: When your browser tab is not focused, the analysis interval is doubled.
calculation.cacheHelp: Maximum number of symbols kept in memory cache.
calculation.timeframesHelp: Each selected timeframe multiplies API calls.
calculation.newsHelp: Fetch latest news and sentiment for analyzed symbols.
calculation.interval1sTooltip: Best for scalping (<1min trades). High CPU usage.
calculation.interval2sTooltip: Great for intraday trading (1-15min). Moderate CPU.
calculation.interval10sTooltip: Ideal for swing trading (1h+). Low CPU.
calculation.intervalDesc: Controls data freshness vs CPU usage

visuals.burningBordersDesc: Interactive fire effect on element edges

indicators.precisionDesc: Number of decimal places for indicator values
indicators.syncRsiDesc: RSI automatically uses the same timeframe as the chart

data.atrDesc: Checks for trades without ATR value and fetches it automatically.
data.mfeMaeDesc: Calculates Maximum Favorable Excursion (MFE) and Maximum Adverse Excursion (MAE).
data.statusClean: All clean. No missing data found.

errors.slBelowEntry: Long: Stop-Loss must be below entry price.
errors.slAboveEntry: Short: Stop-Loss must be above entry price.
errors.tpBelowSl: Long: Take-Profit target {price} must be above Stop-Loss.
errors.tpAboveEntry: Long: Take-Profit target {price} must be above Entry.
errors.tpAboveSl: Short: Take-Profit target {price} must be below Stop-Loss.
errors.tpBelowEntry: Short: Take-Profit target {price} must be below Entry.
errors.totalPercentExceeded: Total sell percentage ({percent}%) must not exceed 100%.
errors.slDistance: Stop-Loss must have a valid distance from entry price.

doji.name: Doji
doji.description:
A Doji forms when the opening and closing prices are virtually the same. It represents a state of equilibrium between buyers and sellers.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ |\text{Open} - \text{Close}| \le 0.1 \times (\text{High} - \text{Low}) $$
doji.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Indecision. Warning of potential reversal if found at a trend extreme.
*   **Crypto Context:** In low-liquidity crypto pairs, Dojis can form frequently due to lack of trading. Ensure volume is significant.
*   **Stop Loss:** Below the low (for bullish setup) or above the high (bearish).
doji.indicatorCombination: Bollinger Bands squeeze often accompanies Dojis before a breakout. RSI divergence adds weight to a reversal thesis.

spinning_top.name: Spinning Top
spinning_top.description:
Small body centered with long wicks on both sides.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Body} < 0.3 \times \text{Range} $$
spinning_top.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Neutral / Indecision.
*   **Context:** If found in a trend, it signals tiring momentum.
*   **Strategy:** Place bracket orders above High and below Low to catch the breakout.
spinning_top.indicatorCombination: Bollinger Band width often decreases (squeeze) around Spinning Tops.

abandoned_baby_bullish.name: Abandoned Baby (Bullish)
abandoned_baby_bullish.description:
A very rare bullish reversal. 1. Long Bearish. 2. Doji gapping down (isolated). 3. Bullish gapping up.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{High}_{2} < \text{Low}_{1} \text{ and } \text{High}_{2} < \text{Low}_{3} $$
abandoned_baby_bullish.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Trend is completely exhausted.
*   **Action:** Buy immediately on the gap up of the 3rd candle.
*   **Target:** The open of the first bearish candle.
abandoned_baby_bullish.indicatorCombination: Due to its rarity and strength, combining it with other indicators is less critical, but an oversold condition (RSI, Stochastics) before the pattern can reinforce the bullish implication.

belt_hold_bullish.name: Belt Hold (Bullish)
belt_hold_bullish.description:
A long bullish candle opening at its low (no lower wick) and closing near its high.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Open} = \text{Low} $$

  $$ \text{Close} \approx \text{High} $$
belt_hold_bullish.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Entry:** Aggressive buy on the close.
*   **Stop Loss:** Just below the low of the candle.
*   **Crypto:** Watch for this on 4H timeframes at support levels.
belt_hold_bullish.indicatorCombination: High buy volume is required to confirm it's not a 'bull trap'.

breakaway_bullish.name: Breakaway (Bullish)
breakaway_bullish.description:
A long bearish candle followed by a gap down and three small drifting candles, then a strong bullish candle closing the gap.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{5} > \text{Low}_{1} $$
breakaway_bullish.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Oversold bounce turning into reversal.
*   **Entry:** On the 5th candle breakout.
*   **Target:** The top of the first bearish candle.
breakaway_bullish.indicatorCombination: RSI usually deeply oversold (<20) before the reversal candle.

bullish_engulfing.name: Bullish Engulfing
bullish_engulfing.description:
A strong reversal signal where a small bearish candle is followed by a larger bullish candle that completely eclipses the previous body.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Body}_{curr} > \text{Body}_{prev} $$

  $$ \text{Close}_{curr} > \text{Open}_{prev} $$

  $$ \text{Open}_{curr} < \text{Close}_{prev} $$
bullish_engulfing.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Entry:** On the close of the engulfing candle or a pullback to the midpoint of its body.
*   **Stop Loss:** Below the low of the engulfing candle.
*   **Target:** 1.5x to 2x risk distance.
bullish_engulfing.indicatorCombination: High volume on the engulfing candle is critical in crypto to avoid 'fakeouts'. Look for oversold RSI (<30) prior to the pattern.

bullish_harami.name: Bullish Harami
bullish_harami.description:
A large bearish candle followed by a small bullish candle contained within the first body. Also known as an 'Inside Bar'.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{High}_{2} < \text{High}_{1} \text{ and } \text{Low}_{2} > \text{Low}_{1} $$
bullish_harami.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Volatility contraction. Pending breakout.
*   **Strategy:** Trade the breakout of the 'Mother Bar' (first candle) High.
*   **Stop Loss:** Below the Mother Bar Low.
bullish_harami.indicatorCombination: Watch for declining volume on the Harami (consolidation) and a spike on the breakout.

bullish_harami_cross.name: Bullish Harami Cross
bullish_harami_cross.description:
A Bullish Harami where the second candle is a Doji. Indicates higher uncertainty than a regular Harami.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Body}_{2} \approx 0 \text{ and Inside Candle } 1 $$
bullish_harami_cross.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** High probability reversal pending.
*   **Strategy:** Wait for the break of the mother bar high.
bullish_harami_cross.indicatorCombination: Similar to the Bullish Harami, but the Doji component often makes the signal stronger, especially when accompanied by volume on the confirmation candle.

bullish_kicker.name: Bullish Kicker
bullish_kicker.description:
A bearish candle followed immediately by a bullish candle that gaps up and runs. Very strong.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Open}_{2} > \text{High}_{1} $$
bullish_kicker.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Violent sentiment shift, often news-driven.
*   **Action:** Market Buy. Do not wait for pullbacks (they may not come).
*   **Crypto Nuance:** Rare in continuous markets, but seen during major protocol announcements.
bullish_kicker.indicatorCombination: Volume should be massive on the Kicker candle.

concealing_baby_swallow.name: Concealing Baby Swallow
concealing_baby_swallow.description:
Four bearish candles. Two Marubozus, one Hammer, one Engulfing.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Complex Formation} $$
concealing_baby_swallow.interpretation:
### Rules
* Very Rare. Bottom reversal likely.
concealing_baby_swallow.indicatorCombination: Due to its rarity, specific indicator combinations are less documented. Confirmation through volume and subsequent bullish price action is crucial.

dragonfly_doji.name: Dragonfly Doji
dragonfly_doji.description:
A Doji where the Open and Close are at the High of the day. It has a long lower shadow and no upper shadow.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Open} \approx \text{Close} \approx \text{High} $$
dragonfly_doji.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Strong rejection of lower prices (Bullish).
*   **Entry:** Buy on break of the high.
*   **Stop Loss:** Below the long lower tail.
dragonfly_doji.indicatorCombination: Often marks the exact bottom of a flash crash or liquidity sweep in crypto.

hammer.name: Hammer
hammer.description:
A Hammer candle is a bullish reversal pattern in trading that appears at the end of a downtrend. Identification is based on specific geometric ratios between the body and the wick.

### Mathematical Criteria (Formulas)
To objectively define a candle as a Hammer, the following formulas are often used:

*   **Shadow-to-Body Ratio:** The lower shadow (wick) must be at least twice as long as the candle body.

  $$ \text{Lower Shadow} \ge 2 \times |\text{Open} - \text{Close}| $$
*   **Body Position (Fibonacci Method):** The entire candle body must be in the upper third (above the 38.2% Fibonacci retracement) of the candle's total trading range.
*   **Upper Shadow:** It should be very small or non-existent.

  $$ \text{Upper Shadow} \le 0.1 \times \text{Total Range} $$
hammer.interpretation:
### Trading Formulas for Entry and Exit
When a Hammer candle is identified, traders often use standardized formulas for setting order levels:

| Action | Formula / Rule |
| :--- | :--- |
| **Entry (Buy)** | High of the Hammer + small buffer (e.g., 1-2 pips/points). |
| **Stop-Loss (SL)** | Low of the Hammer - small buffer. |
| **Target** | Entry + (2 * (Entry - SL)) for a 2:1 Risk-Reward Ratio. |

### Important Context
*   **Trend:** A Hammer is only significant after a clear downtrend (at least 3-5 falling candles).
*   **Confirmation:** Many traders wait for the next candle; if it closes above the high of the Hammer, the signal is confirmed.
*   **Context:** The success rate increases significantly if the Hammer occurs at a known support zone or a moving average (e.g., 50 EMA).
hammer.indicatorCombination: A Hammer at a key support line or a moving average is a stronger signal. An increase in volume on the Hammer candle or the confirmation candle supports the reversal.

homing_pigeon.name: Homing Pigeon
homing_pigeon.description:
Bullish Reversal. Bearish candle followed by smaller bearish inside candle.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Inside Bar (Bear/Bear)} $$
homing_pigeon.indicatorCombination: A bullish divergence on an oscillator (e.g., RSI, MACD) can reinforce the Homing Pigeon signal. Look for a confirmation candle with higher volume.

inverted_hammer.name: Inverted Hammer
inverted_hammer.description:
A bullish reversal pattern appearing after a downtrend. Small body at the bottom, long upper wick.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Upper Shadow} \ge 2 \times \text{Body} $$

  $$ \text{Lower Shadow} < \text{Body} $$
inverted_hammer.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Buying pressure is testing higher levels.
*   **Confirmation:** Essential. Wait for the next candle to close higher.
*   **Stop Loss:** Below the low of the Inverted Hammer.
inverted_hammer.indicatorCombination: Look for a volume spike on the Inverted Hammer compared to previous bearish candles.

ladder_bottom.name: Ladder Bottom
ladder_bottom.description:
Three black crows, then inverted hammer, then strong bullish candle.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ 3 \times \text{Bear} \to \text{Inv. Hammer} \to \text{Bull} $$
ladder_bottom.interpretation:
### Rules
* Buy the breakout of the last candle.
ladder_bottom.indicatorCombination: An increase in volume on the fifth (breakout) candle is a strong confirmation sign. It can also be supported by the breaking of a short-term downtrend line.

matching_low.name: Matching Low
matching_low.description:
Two bearish candles closing at same low.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{1} = \text{Close}_{2} $$
matching_low.interpretation:
### Rules
* Support confirmed. Buy with tight stop.
matching_low.indicatorCombination: Its appearance at a known support line or in an oversold zone (RSI) can increase the significance of the Matching Low. A confirmation candle with volume is important.

morning_doji_star.name: Morning Doji Star
morning_doji_star.description:
Like Morning Star but the middle candle is a Doji. More bearish implications for the star itself, leading to a stronger reversal if confirmed.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Body}_{2} \approx 0 $$
morning_doji_star.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Strong Bullish Reversal.
*   **Entry:** On the 3rd candle close.
morning_doji_star.indicatorCombination: Volume should be low on the Doji. A significant increase in volume on the third (bullish) candle is a strong confirmation feature. An oversold condition (RSI) before the pattern increases its significance.

morning_star.name: Morning Star
morning_star.description:
A three-candle bullish reversal pattern: 1. Long bearish candle. 2. Small gap-down candle (Star). 3. Strong bullish candle closing into the first body.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{3} > \frac{\text{Open}_{1} + \text{Close}_{1}}{2} $$
morning_star.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Entry:** On the opening of the 4th candle.
*   **Stop Loss:** Below the low of the 'Star' (middle candle).
*   **Context:** Stronger if the third candle has high volume.
morning_star.indicatorCombination: The 'Star' often coincides with an RSI dip below 30. A subsequent move above 30 confirms the reversal.

piercing_line.name: Piercing Line
piercing_line.description:
Two-candle bullish reversal. Bearish candle followed by a bullish candle that opens lower but closes above the midpoint of the first.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{2} > \frac{\text{Open}_{1} + \text{Close}_{1}}{2} $$
piercing_line.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Buyers are rejecting the lows and regaining territory.
*   **Crypto Context:** 'Gaps' are small in crypto; look for the strong close above the midpoint.
piercing_line.indicatorCombination: RSI crossing back above 30 from oversold territory confirms the move.

stick_sandwich.name: Stick Sandwich
stick_sandwich.description:
Two bearish candles with a bullish candle sandwiched in between. The two bearish candles close at the same price (Support).

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{3} = \text{Close}_{1} $$
stick_sandwich.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Bullish Reversal / Double Bottom.
*   **Entry:** Buy the support test at Close 3.
stick_sandwich.indicatorCombination: Its appearance at a key support line or a moving average increases its significance. Volume confirmation on the middle bullish candle or the subsequent confirmation candle is positive.

three_inside_up.name: Three Inside Up
three_inside_up.description:
Confirmed Bullish Harami. 1. Bearish. 2. Small Bullish (Inside). 3. Bullish closing above 2.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{3} > \text{High}_{2} $$
three_inside_up.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Confirmed Reversal.
*   **Entry:** On the close of the 3rd candle.
three_inside_up.indicatorCombination: Higher probability than a standalone Harami.

three_outside_up.name: Three Outside Up
three_outside_up.description:
Confirmed Bullish Engulfing. 1. Bearish. 2. Engulfing Bullish. 3. Bullish closing higher.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{3} > \text{High}_{2} $$
three_outside_up.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Strong Reversal.
*   **Entry:** Aggressive traders entered on candle 2; conservative enter on 3.

three_white_soldiers.name: Three White Soldiers
three_white_soldiers.description:
Three consecutive long bullish candles with higher closes. Each opens within the previous body.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{i} > \text{Close}_{i-1} \quad \text{for } i=2,3 $$
three_white_soldiers.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Very strong trend continuation or reversal.
*   **Caution:** If candles are too large, market may be overextended (parabolic).
*   **Strategy:** Wait for a small pullback after the 3rd soldier to enter.
three_white_soldiers.indicatorCombination: ADX (Average Directional Index) should be rising, indicating strengthening trend.

tower_bottom.name: Tower Bottom
tower_bottom.description:
Long bearish candle, consolidation, then long bullish breakout.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Long Bear} \to \text{Base} \to \text{Long Bull} $$
tower_bottom.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Rounding Bottom.
*   **Entry:** On the breakout of the 'Tower' walls.
tower_bottom.indicatorCombination: Volume is often low during the consolidation phase. A significant increase in volume on the breakout bullish candles is a strong confirmation feature. A bullish divergence in the RSI during consolidation can reinforce the signal.

tri_star_bullish.name: Tri-Star (Bullish)
tri_star_bullish.description:
Three Dojis in a row with the middle one gapping down.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Body}_{1,2,3} \approx 0 $$
tri_star_bullish.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Rare major bottom.
*   **Context:** Extreme indecision resolved by next bullish candle.
tri_star_bullish.indicatorCombination: Volume is typically low on all three Dojis. An increase on a bullish confirmation candle is crucial. An oversold condition before the pattern increases the probability of a reversal.

tweezer_bottoms.name: Tweezer Bottoms
tweezer_bottoms.description:
Two or more candles with matching lows. The bodies can be different sizes/colors.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Low}_{1} \approx \text{Low}_{2} $$
tweezer_bottoms.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Support level holds.
*   **Entry:** Buy with Stop Loss just below the Tweezer Lows.
*   **Crypto:** Very reliable on higher timeframes (Daily/Weekly).
tweezer_bottoms.indicatorCombination: Look for bullish divergence on RSI or MACD.

unique_three_river_bottom.name: Unique Three River Bottom
unique_three_river_bottom.description:
1. Long Bear. 2. Hammer (Bearish). 3. Small Bullish below 2.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Complex Sequence} $$
unique_three_river_bottom.interpretation:
### Rules
* Rare. Wait for close above candle 2 high.
unique_three_river_bottom.indicatorCombination: Due to its rarity, confirmation through increased volume on the third candle or a subsequent bullish candle is particularly important. Oversold oscillators can support the signal.

mat_hold.name: Mat Hold
mat_hold.description:
A strong bullish candle, a small gap up, and three small corrective candles staying above the first candle's low, followed by a new breakout.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Min}(\text{Lows}_{2,3,4}) > \text{Low}_{1} $$
mat_hold.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Bullish trend continuation (Flag pattern).
*   **Entry:** On the break of the highest high of the consolidation.
*   **Stop Loss:** Below the first candle's low.
mat_hold.indicatorCombination: Volume should drop during the small corrective candles.

rising_three_methods.name: Rising Three Methods
rising_three_methods.description:
Similar to Mat Hold but the corrective candles stay strictly within the first candle's range.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{High}_{2,3,4} < \text{High}_{1} \text{ and } \text{Low}_{2,3,4} > \text{Low}_{1} $$
rising_three_methods.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Trend Pause.
*   **Action:** Add to positions on the breakout of the first candle's high.

separating_lines_bullish.name: Separating Lines (Bullish)
separating_lines_bullish.description:
Bearish then Bullish. Open prices are equal.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Open}_{1} = \text{Open}_{2} $$
separating_lines_bullish.interpretation:
### Rules
* Continuation. Trade with the trend.
separating_lines_bullish.indicatorCombination: An increase in volume on the second (bullish) candle can underscore the strength of the trend continuation. The pattern is stronger when it occurs above a key moving average.

side_by_side_white_lines_bullish.name: Side-by-Side White Lines (Bullish)
side_by_side_white_lines_bullish.description:
Bullish trend, Gap Up, two similar white candles side-by-side.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Gap Up} \to \text{Twin Bulls} $$
side_by_side_white_lines_bullish.indicatorCombination: Volume should at least remain stable or increase on the gaps and bullish candles to confirm strength. A MACD remaining in the bullish zone supports the signal.

upside_gap_three_methods.name: Upside Gap Three Methods
upside_gap_three_methods.description:
Bullish trend, gap up, fill gap, resume.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Gap Fill} $$
upside_gap_three_methods.interpretation:
### Rules
* Buy if gap holds as support.
upside_gap_three_methods.indicatorCombination: Volume should be high on the first two bullish candles (especially the gapping candle). Lower volume is desirable on the third (corrective bearish) candle. A renewed increase on the trend continuation is positive.

upside_tasuki_gap.name: Upside Tasuki Gap
upside_tasuki_gap.description:
Bullish Gap, then small bear candle stays in gap.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{3} > \text{Close}_{1} $$
upside_tasuki_gap.indicatorCombination: Volume should increase on the second candle (gap up). Lower volume on the third (bearish) candle is typical. A renewed volume increase on the trend continuation is positive.

bullish_marubozu.name: Bullish Marubozu
bullish_marubozu.description:
A long bullish candle with no shadows. Open is Low, Close is High.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Open} = \text{Low} \text{ and } \text{Close} = \text{High} $$
bullish_marubozu.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Total buyer dominance.
*   **Strategy:** Buy the close. Use the midpoint of the body as support on pullbacks.
bullish_marubozu.indicatorCombination: Often starts a fresh trend leg. Check ADX for trend strength.

abandoned_baby_bearish.name: Abandoned Baby (Bearish)
abandoned_baby_bearish.description:
Rare bearish reversal. 1. Long Bullish. 2. Doji gapping up (isolated). 3. Bearish gapping down.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Low}_{2} > \text{High}_{1} \text{ and } \text{Low}_{2} > \text{High}_{3} $$
abandoned_baby_bearish.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Major Top.
*   **Action:** Sell/Short immediately.
*   **Stop Loss:** Above the Doji high.
abandoned_baby_bearish.indicatorCombination: An overbought condition (RSI, Stochastics) before the pattern can reinforce the bearish implication. Volume should be low on the Doji and increase significantly on the third, strong bearish candle.

advance_block.name: Advance Block
advance_block.description:
Three bullish candles with successively smaller bodies and longer upper wicks. A sign of weakening momentum.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Body}_{3} < \text{Body}_{2} < \text{Body}_{1} $$
advance_block.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Rally is stalling.
*   **Action:** Tighten stops on existing longs. Do not open new longs.
*   **Context:** Often seen at the end of parabolic crypto pumps.
advance_block.indicatorCombination: Bearish divergence on RSI is almost always present.

belt_hold_bearish.name: Belt Hold (Bearish)
belt_hold_bearish.description:
A long bearish candle opening at its high (no upper wick) and closing near its low.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Open} = \text{High} $$

  $$ \text{Close} \approx \text{Low} $$
belt_hold_bearish.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Entry:** Short on close.
*   **Stop Loss:** Just above the high.
*   **Signal:** Sellers controlled the entire session.
belt_hold_bearish.indicatorCombination: Often occurs when a resistance level is tested and rejected immediately.

breakaway_bearish.name: Breakaway (Bearish)
breakaway_bearish.description:
Bullish, Gap Up, Stalling, Bearish Break.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{5} < \text{High}_{1} $$
breakaway_bearish.indicatorCombination: An increase in volume on the fifth (breakout) candle is a strong confirmation sign. It can also be supported by the breaking of a short-term uptrend line.

bearish_engulfing.name: Bearish Engulfing
bearish_engulfing.description:
A bearish reversal pattern where a small bullish candle is followed by a larger bearish candle that consumes the previous body.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Body}_{curr} > \text{Body}_{prev} $$

  $$ \text{Close}_{curr} < \text{Open}_{prev} $$

  $$ \text{Open}_{curr} > \text{Close}_{prev} $$
bearish_engulfing.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Entry:** Short on close of the second candle.
*   **Stop Loss:** Above the high of the engulfing candle.
*   **Crypto Context:** Effective at all-time highs or resistance retests.
bearish_engulfing.indicatorCombination: Bearish divergence on MACD or RSI significantly increases success rate.

bearish_harami.name: Bearish Harami
bearish_harami.description:
A large bullish candle followed by a small bearish candle contained within the first body.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{High}_{2} < \text{High}_{1} \text{ and } \text{Low}_{2} > \text{Low}_{1} $$
bearish_harami.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Momentum pause.
*   **Strategy:** Short the breakout of the Mother Bar Low.
*   **Target:** The start of the previous trend impulse.
bearish_harami.indicatorCombination: Often forms a 'Bear Flag' on lower timeframes.

bearish_harami_cross.name: Bearish Harami Cross
bearish_harami_cross.description:
A Bearish Harami where the second candle is a Doji.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Body}_{2} \approx 0 \text{ and Inside Candle } 1 $$
bearish_harami_cross.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Top formation.
*   **Strategy:** Short on break of mother bar low.
bearish_harami_cross.indicatorCombination: Similar to the Bearish Harami, but the Doji component often makes the signal stronger, especially when accompanied by volume on the confirmation candle.

bearish_kicker.name: Bearish Kicker
bearish_kicker.description:
A bullish candle followed immediately by a bearish candle that gaps down and crashes.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Open}_{2} < \text{Low}_{1} $$
bearish_kicker.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Panic selling.
*   **Action:** Market Short or close Longs immediately.
*   **Stop Loss:** Above the gap.
bearish_kicker.indicatorCombination: Usually accompanied by extreme volume spikes.

dark_cloud_cover.name: Dark Cloud Cover
dark_cloud_cover.description:
Two-candle bearish reversal. Bullish candle followed by a bearish candle that opens higher but closes below the midpoint of the first.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{2} < \frac{\text{Open}_{1} + \text{Close}_{1}}{2} $$
dark_cloud_cover.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Sellers are stepping in aggressively.
*   **Entry:** Short on the close or break of the low.
*   **Stop Loss:** Above the high of the formation.
dark_cloud_cover.indicatorCombination: Bearish divergence on the Stochastic oscillator often accompanies this pattern.

deliberation_stalled.name: Deliberation / Stalled Pattern
deliberation_stalled.description:
Three white soldiers, but last one is small/star.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Body}_{3} \ll \text{Body}_{1,2} $$
deliberation_stalled.indicatorCombination: Decreasing volume over the three candles can signal waning buying power. A bearish divergence on oscillators (RSI, MACD) would reinforce the reversal signal.

evening_doji_star.name: Evening Doji Star
evening_doji_star.description:
Like Evening Star but the middle candle is a Doji.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Body}_{2} \approx 0 $$
evening_doji_star.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Strong Bearish Reversal.
*   **Entry:** Short on the 3rd candle close.
evening_doji_star.indicatorCombination: Volume should be low on the Doji. A significant increase in volume on the third (bearish) candle is a strong confirmation feature. An overbought condition (RSI) before the pattern increases its significance.

evening_star.name: Evening Star
evening_star.description:
A three-candle bearish reversal pattern: 1. Long bullish candle. 2. Small gap-up candle (Star). 3. Strong bearish candle closing deeply into the first body.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{3} < \frac{\text{Open}_{1} + \text{Close}_{1}}{2} $$
evening_star.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Entry:** Short on the 4th candle open.
*   **Stop Loss:** Above the high of the 'Star'.
*   **Crypto Nuance:** Gaps are rare in continuous crypto markets; the shape is more important than the gap itself.
evening_star.indicatorCombination: Look for decreasing volume on the first candle and increasing volume on the third (bearish) candle.

gravestone_doji.name: Gravestone Doji
gravestone_doji.description:
A Doji where the Open and Close are at the Low of the day. It has a long upper shadow and no lower shadow.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Open} \approx \text{Close} \approx \text{Low} $$
gravestone_doji.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Rejection of higher prices (Bearish).
*   **Entry:** Short on break of the low.
*   **Stop Loss:** Above the long upper wick.
gravestone_doji.indicatorCombination: Volume spike on the wick formation indicates 'smart money' selling into strength.

hanging_man.name: Hanging Man
hanging_man.description:
Bearish reversal pattern after an uptrend. Same shape as Hammer but at the top.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Lower Shadow} \ge 2 \times \text{Body} $$

  $$ \text{Upper Shadow} \le 0.1 \times \text{Range} $$
hanging_man.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Weakness. Buyers pushed price up but sellers forced it down during the session.
*   **Entry:** Short below the hanging man's low.
*   **Stop Loss:** Above the high.
hanging_man.indicatorCombination: Often appears at resistance levels identified by Fibonacci extensions.

shooting_star.name: Shooting Star
shooting_star.description:
A bearish single-candle pattern with a small body at the bottom and a long upper wick. It signals rejection of higher prices.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Upper Shadow} \ge 2 \times \text{Body} $$

  $$ \text{Lower Shadow} \approx 0 $$
shooting_star.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Entry:** Short below the low of the Shooting Star.
*   **Stop Loss:** Above the high of the upper wick.
*   **Risk:** High volatility can trigger stops easily; use ATR buffer.
shooting_star.indicatorCombination: Ideally forms at the upper Bollinger Band. Overbought RSI (>70) is a standard confirmation.

three_black_crows.name: Three Black Crows
three_black_crows.description:
Three consecutive long bearish candles with lower closes. Each opens within the previous body.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{i} < \text{Close}_{i-1} \quad \text{for } i=2,3 $$
three_black_crows.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Dominant selling pressure.
*   **Strategy:** Short on the close of the 3rd crow, or better, on a retest of the 2nd crow's low.
three_black_crows.indicatorCombination: Check for increasing volume on each crow. If volume decreases, the dump might be losing steam.

three_inside_down.name: Three Inside Down
three_inside_down.description:
Confirmed Bearish Harami. 1. Bullish. 2. Inside Bearish. 3. Bearish closing lower.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{3} < \text{Low}_{2} $$
three_inside_down.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Reversal confirmed.
*   **Entry:** Close of 3rd candle.
three_inside_down.indicatorCombination: An increase in volume on the third candle strengthens the signal. The pattern is more reliable when it occurs in an overbought zone (RSI) or at a resistance level.

three_outside_down.name: Three Outside Down
three_outside_down.description:
Confirmed Bearish Engulfing. 1. Bullish. 2. Engulfing Bearish. 3. Bearish closing lower.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{3} < \text{Low}_{2} $$
three_outside_down.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Strong Reversal.
*   **Entry:** Close of 3rd candle.
three_outside_down.indicatorCombination: Increasing volume on the second and third candles increases reliability. Its appearance after an overbought phase (RSI) or at a resistance line reinforces the signal.

tower_top.name: Tower Top
tower_top.description:
Long bullish candle, consolidation, then long bearish drop.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Long Bull} \to \text{Base} \to \text{Long Bear} $$
tower_top.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Rounding Top.
*   **Entry:** Breakdown of support.
tower_top.indicatorCombination: Volume is often low during the consolidation phase. A significant increase in volume on the breakout bearish candles is a strong confirmation feature. A bearish divergence in the RSI during consolidation can reinforce the signal.

tri_star_bearish.name: Tri-Star (Bearish)
tri_star_bearish.description:
Three Dojis in a row with the middle one gapping up.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Body}_{1,2,3} \approx 0 $$
tri_star_bearish.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Rare major top.
*   **Context:** Extreme indecision at highs.
tri_star_bearish.indicatorCombination: Volume is typically low on all three Dojis. An increase on a bearish confirmation candle is crucial. An overbought condition before the pattern increases the probability of a reversal.

tweezer_tops.name: Tweezer Tops
tweezer_tops.description:
Two or more candles with matching highs.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{High}_{1} \approx \text{High}_{2} $$
tweezer_tops.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Resistance holds (Double Top).
*   **Entry:** Short with Stop Loss just above the Tweezer Highs.
tweezer_tops.indicatorCombination: Often coincides with key Fibonacci retracement levels.

downside_gap_three_methods.name: Downside Gap Three Methods
downside_gap_three_methods.description:
Bearish trend, gap down, fill gap, resume.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Gap Fill} $$
downside_gap_three_methods.interpretation:
### Rules
* Short if gap holds as resistance.
downside_gap_three_methods.indicatorCombination: Volume should be high on the first two bearish candles (especially the gapping candle). Lower volume is desirable on the third (corrective bullish) candle.

downside_tasuki_gap.name: Downside Tasuki Gap
downside_tasuki_gap.description:
Bearish Gap, then small bull candle stays in gap.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{3} < \text{Close}_{1} $$
downside_tasuki_gap.indicatorCombination: Volume should increase on the second candle (gap down). Lower volume on the third (bullish) candle is typical.

falling_three_methods.name: Falling Three Methods
falling_three_methods.description:
A long bearish candle, followed by three small bullish candles within the first candle's range, then a new bearish drop.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{High}_{2,3,4} < \text{High}_{1} \text{ and } \text{Low}_{2,3,4} > \text{Low}_{1} $$
falling_three_methods.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Bearish continuation (Bear Flag).
*   **Entry:** Short on the break of the first candle's low.
falling_three_methods.indicatorCombination: Volume often dries up on the small pullback candles.

in_neck_line.name: In Neck Line
in_neck_line.description:
Bearish, then Bullish closing slightly into body.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{2} \approx \text{Low}_{1} $$
in_neck_line.interpretation:
### Rules
* Weak pullback. Trend likely continues down.
in_neck_line.indicatorCombination: No strong volume indication, but an increase on the continuation of the downtrend would be confirming. The pattern is stronger when it occurs below a key moving average.

on_neck_line.name: On Neck Line
on_neck_line.description:
Bearish, then Bullish closing at low.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{2} = \text{Low}_{1} $$
on_neck_line.indicatorCombination: Similar to In Neck Line. A MACD remaining in the bearish zone or showing a bearish crossover can support the signal.

separating_lines_bearish.name: Separating Lines (Bearish)
separating_lines_bearish.description:
Bullish then Bearish. Open prices are equal.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Open}_{1} = \text{Open}_{2} $$
separating_lines_bearish.interpretation:
### Rules
* Continuation. Trade with the trend.
separating_lines_bearish.indicatorCombination: An increase in volume on the second (bearish) candle can underscore the strength of the trend continuation. The pattern is stronger when it occurs below a key moving average.

thrusting_line.name: Thrusting Line
thrusting_line.description:
Bearish, then Bullish closing below midpoint.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Close}_{2} < \text{Midpoint}_{1} $$
thrusting_line.indicatorCombination: No strong specific volume indication. The pattern is weaker than a Piercing Line and should be treated with caution; confirmation by further bearish candles is important.

two_black_gapping_candles.name: Two Black Gapping Candles
two_black_gapping_candles.description:
Bearish trend, two candles gapping down sequentially.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Gap}_{1} \text{ and } \text{Gap}_{2} $$
two_black_gapping_candles.indicatorCombination: Volume may increase on the gapping candles, confirming the bearish momentum. A break of key support levels after the pattern reinforces the signal.

bearish_marubozu.name: Bearish Marubozu
bearish_marubozu.description:
A long bearish candle with no shadows. Open is High, Close is Low.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Open} = \text{High} \text{ and } \text{Close} = \text{Low} $$
bearish_marubozu.interpretation:
### Trading Rules
*   **Signal:** Total seller dominance.
*   **Strategy:** Sell/Short. Do not try to catch the knife until a reversal pattern forms.
bearish_marubozu.indicatorCombination: If volume is low, it might be a liquidity trap. High volume confirms validity.

retracing_wicks.name: Retracing Wicks
retracing_wicks.description:
Multiple candles with long upper wicks at resistance.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{High}_{1} \approx \text{High}_{2} \text{ w/ Wicks} $$
retracing_wicks.indicatorCombination: The signal is stronger if the wick candles occur on high volume. A bearish divergence on oscillators (RSI, MACD) increases the significance.

advancing_wicks.name: Advancing Wicks
advancing_wicks.description:
Multiple candles with long lower wicks at support.

### Mathematical Criteria

  $$ \text{Low}_{1} \approx \text{Low}_{2} \text{ w/ Wicks} $$
advancing_wicks.indicatorCombination: The signal is reinforced by high volume on the wick candles and the bullish confirmation candle. A bullish divergence in the RSI or MACD makes a successful reversal more likely.

cloud.title: Community Cloud (Beta)
cloud.description: Connect to SpacetimeDB to chat with other traders.
